solution_line_template: Rachel spends {setup_time} + {cleanup_time} = <<{setup_time}+{cleanup_time}={total_setup_cleanup_time}>>{total_setup_cleanup_time} hours setting up and cleaning up.
She paints for {time_per_painting} hour x {num_paintings} paintings = <<{time_per_painting}*{num_paintings}={total_painting_time}>>{total_painting_time} hours.
Then she edits {time_per_video_edit} hours x {num_videos} videos = <<{time_per_video_edit}*{num_videos}={total_editing_time}>>{total_editing_time} hours.

She spends {total_setup_cleanup_time} + {total_painting_time} + {total_editing_time} = <<{total_setup_cleanup_time}+{total_painting_time}+{total_editing_time}={total_time_for_4_videos}>>{total_time_for_4_videos} hours to make 4 videos.
So Rachel spends {total_time_for_4_videos} / {num_videos} = <<{total_time_for_4_videos}/{num_videos}={time_per_video}>>{time_per_video} hours on each video.
